translation: I've just finished my work as the supporting male of the soap opera Spring in the Office.
transcript: 刚刚完成了，电视连续剧《办公室的春天》的拍摄工作，我出任的是男二号的角色。

translation: I heard that many made fun of me for not being good-looking enough to act.
transcript: 很多人说唐骏就你这个长相还去演电视剧。

translation: Let me make it clear. The director would like an instinctive actor as the president of a company in the opera, so they searched online "The top ten handsome presidents in China".
transcript: 因为剧组他们想找一位本色的演员，出任一位总裁，所以他们在网上搜了一下，叫做“中国十大帅哥总裁”。

translation: I don't know how I stood out in the appraisal, but you won't believe who those candidates were.
transcript: 他们不知道怎么评出来的，但是你知道吗，都是什么样的人在参加评选呢。

translation: How could I not be chosen among people like Jack Ma and Shi Yuzhu?
transcript: 什么马云啊，什么史玉柱啊，哎，你们说我我们二十个人站在台上，还需要评吗？

translation: This reminds me of a famous saying by Jack Ma — A man of wisdom is often not good-looking.
transcript: 当然，马云有一个经典的名言，他说：“男人的智慧和长相通常是成反比的。”

translation: Don't you think he is a perfect example of this saying?
transcript: 哎我觉得这句话太适合他啦，意思你懂的？

translation: I personally think him as the most intelligent of our kind.
transcript: 因为他是我们周围企业家当中我觉得是最具智慧的那么一个男人。

translation: Well, let's go down to the business. I'm here today to share with you the lessons I learnt from my past life.
transcript: 其实今天来我想跟大家一起来分享我的人生的一些感悟。

translation: What is life?
transcript: 什么是人生？

translation: As for me, it is a journey.
transcript: 其实，人生就是一个旅途。

translation: A journey always has its destination, and all humans share a common one, whether you choose it or not, it is waiting for you at the end of life.
transcript: 既然是旅途，就会有终点，而且有意思的是我们全人类的终点都是一样的，你选择它，不选择它，我们都得到那个终点。

translation: When reaching the destination, the greater ones can have their portraits on the wall,
transcript: 当你到达终点以后，伟大一点，就是挂在墙上。

translation: In China, places are limited, most of which have already been taken.
transcript: 在中国，挂在墙上的名额是有限制的，而且名额已经被占了。

translation: So, when you become aware of that, you really don’t need to pursue it, for you can't avoid it anyway.
transcript: 所以，我觉得当你想到这样的结果的时候，你真的不用去追求，你也绕不过它。

translation: Well then, what is the most important thing in life?
transcript: 所以人生什么最重要？

translation: I believe it's the process.
transcript: 我觉得是它的过程。

translation: Since it is a process, there will be laughs, tears as well as storms.
transcript: 既然是人生的过程，我们说有欢笑，有哭泣，当然也有风雨。

translation: We always hear that a life without hardships would be incomplete.
transcript: 书上说，说“一个人没有经过风雨的人生是不完整的。”

translation: From this point, I reckon my life to be more complete than any one of you.
transcript: 我觉得在这个意义上来说我唐骏肯定比在座的每一位的人生都要完整得多得多。

translation: You know what I mean.
transcript: 意思你懂的。

translation: Back in 1990, 24 years ago, I was a post graduate student pursuing a degree at the Nagoya University.
transcript: 我们看整个的时光，我把时光倒流到24年前的1990年，那个时候唐骏是日本名古屋大学的一位研究生，在攻读他那个学位。

translation: I didn't mention that I was pursuing a doctor's degree, just keep it low.
transcript: 你看在这里我都尽量不把博士学位说出来，为了低调一点。

translation: At a regular result presentation, my supervisor Itakura Fumitada was not pleased with my work and said, "Maybe you can write a paper with such a result back in your country, but it's not possible in Japan."
transcript: 在一次的例行的研究成果发表会上，我的导师板仓文忠对我真的非常地不满，最后他居然用了这么一句话，他说：“唐骏你这个研究成果拿回你中国也许可以把它变成一篇论文，但是在日本是不可能的。”

translation: Hearing this, I felt a sting in my vulnerable heart.
transcript: 你想想，当时一个弱小的我，那种心灵受到的那种刺伤的那种感觉。

translation: Not being able to put up with it, I angrily slammed the materials down on the desk.
transcript: 我实在实在不能忍下去了，我愤怒了，我把我手中的资料，失摔在了桌子上。

translation: The action left me with only one option, for I actually had to make a decision.
transcript: 你要知道，这一摔给了我一个选择，或者说我不得不做出的一个选择。

translation: What was my decision?
transcript: 这个选择是什么？

translation: It was to antagonize my supervisor; what I chose was to leave Japan; what I chose was to let go of the degree for which I was yearning and made strenuous efforts for five years, a degree that I would had acquired in merely six months.
transcript: 我选择了和我的导师对立；我选择了什么，我必须离开日本；我选择了什么，我选择了我已经苦苦攻读的五年还有六个月就可以拿到手的那个学位。

translation: Many asked if I have ever regretted, regretted of the slam and the decision I made.
transcript: 很多人会问我说唐骏你是不是后悔了？那一摔，那一次的选择是不是后悔了。

translation: My answer was no, not because that choice led me to Microsoft and made me who I am today.
transcript: 我没有后悔，并不是说因为，我的那次的选择，让我走进了微软，让我有了今天。

translation: If I had not done so, Itakura Fumitada would never have said that I was the best of his students 20 years later; If I had not done so, the president of the Nagoya University would never have told me that I was a distinguished student of the university.
transcript: 不是那么一摔，20年后那个板仓文忠居然和我说我是他最优秀的学生，不是那一摔，名古屋大学的校长跟我说，我是名古屋大学的杰出校友。

translation: That choice mattered because it preserved a little of my dignity and made me more self-assured before them.
transcript: 我觉得，我觉得那次的选择是什么，让我有了那么一点点的尊严，让我在他们面前有了那么一点点的骨气。

translation: Later on, to make up for this, I took an on-job postgraduate degree in a third-rate university in America.
transcript: 为了弥补这么一个缺憾，我在美国，读了一个九流的所谓的在职研究生。

translation: However, I didn't foresee a huge disturbance on the internet 20 years later.
transcript: 20年后居然在中国形成了一个巨大的网络风波。

translation: A lot of people criticized me for my "academic misconduct".
transcript: 很多人批评我，批判我。

translation: During that time, many asked if I felt depressed about it.
transcript: 很多人会说：“唐骏你郁闷吗？”

translation: How could a man in that situation be depressed?
transcript: 这怎么叫郁闷？

translation: I didn’t feel that way but I did feel at rage and helpless.
transcript: 那是一种愤怒，那是一种无奈。

translation: Then, how do you define depression?
transcript: 什么是郁闷？

translation: Before the Spring Festival of this year when I saw a kid of my family smoking in the toilets, I said to him that it was inappropriate to smoke when he was in middle school.
transcript: 春节前，我看到一个亲戚的小孩，在厕所里抽烟，我说你这么年轻是个初中生你就抽烟。

translation: "I am depressed about the Diaoyu island issue." He answered.
transcript: 他的回答说：“钓鱼岛问题没解决，心情很郁闷。”

translation: That state of mind could be described as a sort of depression, but how could mine be like that?
transcript: 那是一种郁闷的感觉，而我那个怎么叫郁闷呢？

translation: The same day as today twelve years ago, I was already the president of Microsoft China.
transcript: 时光，继续倒流，倒流在12年前的今天，那个时候，我已经是微软中国公司的总裁了。

translation: In those days, Internet industry was still at its infancy.
transcript: 那个时候互联网可能也刚刚开始。

translation: With Internet, what kind of applications is the most frequently used?
transcript: 在互联网上，人们用的最多的一个应用是什么应用？

translation: The chatting apps.
transcript: 叫做聊天的这么一个应用。

translation: At that time, Microsoft rolled out a chatting application called MSN, whose market share was much larger than that of its twin in China, Tencent QQ.
transcript: 当时的微软，有一个聊天工具叫MSN，它的市场份额要遥遥领先于在中国有这么一个小弟弟，叫腾讯的QQ。

translation: However, I found that the growth rate in user number of QQ was much higher than that of MSN.
transcript: 但是我发现，我发现，QQ的用户的增长要远远高出微软MSN的增长。

translation: I noticed there was only one function of QQ that MSN didn't have.
transcript: 而且我发现，腾讯只有一个功能是微软的MSN所不具备的。

translation: What is that?
transcript: 什么功能？

translation: Chatting with strangers, as you could see.
transcript: 和陌生人聊天这么一个功能，意思你懂的。

translation: I told Gates that and warned him, "We will lose to Tencent if we don't provide that function."
transcript: 我就和盖茨说，我说：“如果我们微软公司不增加这个功能，我们一定会输给腾讯的。”

translation: "Why do Chinese people love to chat with strangers?" asked Gates.
transcript: 盖茨说：“你们中国人为什么喜欢和陌生人聊天？”

translation: "That's a need of all humans!" I answered.
transcript: 我说：“那是人类的一种需求啊！”

translation: He didn’t believe it and said, "It must a particular need of Chinese men."
transcript: 他说：“一定是你们中国男人的需求。”

translation: Let's think about this, what kind of psychological states it takes for a man to chat with another man all day long?
transcript: 你想想，一个男人，整天在网上和一个陌生的男人聊天，那需要多强的心理素质啊？

translation: "No, it's a mutual need" I insisted.
transcript: “不是的，是双方的需求。”

translation: Gates finally accepted my opinion and became willing to provide this function only to the Chinese market, with a condition, though.
transcript: 最后，盖茨接受了我的想法，愿意为中国这个市场单独增加这一个功能，但是有一个条件。

translation: The Microsoft China must promise that MSN would gain 1.5 million dollars of income from advertising in three years to compensate the expenses in development and maintenance.
transcript: 说微软中国公司要承诺，承诺未来的三年，在MSN上要获得150万美金的广告用来弥补开发和维护的费用。

translation: What in front of me was that I needed to make a decision, however, there is no other options.
transcript: 面临的面前就是我需要作一个选择，但是，我没有选择。

translation: Why not?
transcript: 为什么没有选择？

translation: Because I dared not.
transcript: 因为我不敢选择。

translation: Why did I?
transcript: 为什么不敢？

translation: Because I cared the position too much to lose it, so I dropped the option.
transcript: 因为我太在乎微软公司的这么一个职位了，我放弃了。

translation: What is the consequence of that decision?
transcript: 放弃的结果是什么？

translation: As we known, MSN was finally weeded out of the market last year.
transcript: 我们都知道MSN在去年正式退出了历史的舞台。

translation: I wonder that if I had made the decision then, perhaps the Internet pattern in China would have been changed dramatically; if I had made the decision,  maybe Ballmer, who I appreciated so much, wouldn't have to resign.
transcript: 我在想，如果那一次我选择了，中国的互联网的格局，有可能会发生一个很大的变化；如果我选择了，我喜欢的鲍尔默，也许就不用下课了。

translation: I think that's why people say that the delight of life lies in infinite choices, for you can't foresee the consequences.
transcript: 所以我们说，人生的精彩在于什么，就是在于不断地在选择，因为你不知道结果。

translation: Some asked me what the biggest lesson I learnt from all my experiences.
transcript: 很多人也会说唐骏，你经历了那么多，你的最大的感悟是什么。

translation: The answer was to have the courage to make choices.
transcript: 我觉得我就是在敢于做选择。

translation: Another question is how I made it through in my most difficult times when I encountered hardships.
transcript: 也有人问说，你的人生在你遇到最困难的时候，遇到挫折的时候，你是怎么走过来的。

translation: As for this, I'd like to share with you Tang's method of bottom-line stress reduction.
transcript: 我想跟大家分享的是，我有一个叫做所谓的唐氏底线抗压法。

translation: Let's stay low-ley and I'll just call it bottom-line stress reduction method.
transcript: 还是低调点就叫底线抗压法吧。

translation: So, what is that?
transcript: 什么叫底线抗压法？

translation: I just get prepared for the worst scenario and think of the countermeasures that you will take when the worst happens.
transcript: 我就是把所有最坏的结果想好，然后当你想到这个结果的时候，如果遇到这么一个最坏的结果。

translation: What will you do then?
transcript: 你会去做什么？

translation: Do you stand for the outcomes?
transcript: 你能不能受得了这么一个结果？

translation: When caught in the Internet disturbance a few years ago, I thought to myself that the worst scenario would be a divorce.
transcript: 我们都知道几年前的网络风波的时候，我就在想，什么是对我最坏的结果，这个最坏的结果，一定是我的太太离我而去。

translation: Many said that " Tang Jun, I can't believe what you think of now is women."
transcript: 很多人说唐骏你就在这个时候居然你想到的还是女人。

translation: It's difficult to be a man, you know, not to mention being a good one.
transcript: 作为一个男人，很难，做个好男人就更难了。

translation: Even so, I am well aware that half of the happiness of a man comes from a woman.
transcript: 但是我在想的是，因为男人的幸福一半是来自于女人的。

translation: However, man is the single source of a woman's happiness.
transcript: 但是你们想过没有，女人的幸福的全部都是来自于男人的。

translation: When thinking about this, I feel quite relaxed.
transcript: 想到这一点其实我也就放松了。

translation: This is how I relieved stress in my past life, with a so-called bottom-line stress reduction method that I decided.
transcript: 这就是我在过去的人生经历当中，我自己选择的一种所谓叫底线的抗压的方式。

translation: I like to say that many of you here today don’t need courage to be here at TnDao.
transcript: 今天我们在座的很多人，我们选择来“听道”，你们不需要勇气。

translation: Before I put an end to my speech, I'd like to say that you do have good tastes to come and listen to me.
transcript: 但是最后，我还是想对那些特意赶来听我唐骏演讲的人说一句，你们真的很有品位。

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢大家！
